info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 3 at 3:34PM PDT until September 3 at 6:32PM PDT by NWS San Diego CA
info.description:
* WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following county, San Diego, just north of Julian.
* WHEN...Until 632 PM PDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 333 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Julian, Hwy 78 Between Banner And S2, Hwy S2 Between Hwy 79 And Hwy 78, Hwy 79 Between Santa Ysabel And Warner Springs, Ranchita, Warner Springs, Hwy 79 Between Julian And Lake Cuyamaca, Hwy 78 Between Ramona And Santa Ysabel, Santa Ysabel Indian Reservation and Santa Ysabel. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 632 PM PDT THIS EVENING
